item.title: Installation
item.description: To install hugo in its latest version, it is better to install with the snap command. snap install hugo If we need Sass/SCSS support: snap install hugo --channel=extended To create a new site: hugo new site <site_name>

item.title: Themes
item.description: We have different ways to install a template. All of them have to leave in the themes folder of our project a folder with the development of the template that we are going to download from git The ways to get this folder can be: Download the development and unzip it in the folder Clone directly to the folder with git clone Clone it as a submodule from the project folder I have used the third way.

item.title: Content
item.description: To create new content we are going to generate text pages with markdown format. We look at how we use different directories to create our organization of our content. Each directory will correspond to a section. Within each section there may be a _index.md file whose content will be displayed when we select the specific directory. Command to create content files and/or sections: hugo new [section]/file.md In the specific case of the learn template, the pages are classified into two types, those that are the head of a topic or section (_index.

item.title: Shortcode
item.description: A shortcode is a fragment of html code that will be rendered within an md file when the system loads or renders said content page. It is a way to give visual effects and to have more functionality within our website. Some of the functions are: Expand text. Read more function One of the functions of shortcodes is to shorten/expand text

item.title: Template
item.description: We must identify the parts of a template. Regardless of the template used, we can talk about: Logo Colors used in the style Main menu Let’s identify those elements in our template and see how to modify them to customize it to our liking. Logo In this template, learn, the logo is loaded after a partial. The partial folder will contain html files that will be part of an html page, so that I can invoke them when I need them.

item.title: Multilanguage
item.description: Hugo allows you to set the multilanguage to adapt the pages in the desired language. To do this, we first modify the configuration file by setting the languages. In the case of practice, I add English, French, and Spanish. [Languages] [Languages.es] title = "Ejemplo para el uso de idiomas" weight = 1 languageName = "Español" [Languages.en] title = "Example use language" weight = 2 languageName = "English" [Languages.fr] title = "Exemple d'utilisation des langues" weight = 3 languageName = "Français" In this case we are going to establish different directories to establish the location of the files.
